value.Subject: RE: Issue #79565: Posting Groups and Vendor Import (Nationwide Studios)
value.BodyPreview:
Hi Jess,

Please see my responses below.


  1.  Vendor Number

Typically it would be a combination of the vendor name and a number.  For example if the vendor is “Staples Inc.”, then a Vendor Number would be “STAP001”.  The maximum number of chara

Body.Content:
Hi Jess,

 

Please see my responses below.

 

  1. Vendor Number

Typically it would be a combination of the vendor name and a number.  For example if the vendor is “Staples Inc.”, then a Vendor Number would be “STAP001”.  The maximum number of characters is 20 for the Vendor Number.  As a side note, in the configuration package, if you hover your mouse over the field, it will indicate the max number of characters for the field (see example below).  The Vendor Number is also a required field, so you will need to assign it to all vendors. 

 

 

  1. Phone Numbers

You can include dashes and/or parenthesis.  When you import the phone number it will format it to what you’ve entered in the config package.

 

  1. Vendor Posting Group

I can see the “DOMESTIC” posting group setup and the payables account is mapped correctly.  You just need to populate the other GLs (i.e. service charges) if they apply to the company. You can also create additional groups later on if needed. 

 

  1. Numbering series

You will need to setup a numbering series for all master records and documents.  Before you import the vendors, you would need to setup the numbering series first and assign it in the “Purchases & Payables Setup” window (see screenshot below).  If you search for “No. Series” it will take you to the setup screen.  Alternatively, if you take a look at the sample config file I had sent previously, that had a list of default/standard numbering series – you can use those as well. 

 

 

  1. EIN Number

If you search for “Company Information” you can populate the identification number there

 

 

We can discuss further in details tomorrow.

 

Thanks,

Katrina


Issue Description:

Submitted by direct email to issuetrack@websan.com.


Hey there!

Attached is a draft of the vendor import; however, I have a few questions:

Column A/No - for best practices, should this be a number rather than text such as a shortened version of the name of the vendor? Based on the answer,
I'll need to assign a name/number to the Legacy vendors at the bottom of the template. Also, is there a limit on how long this code can be?Column H/Phone Number - do I need to change the format of this field and exclude parenthesis?Columns N & T/Posting Groups - I don't think I have these set up correctly so can we review before we import?
Column Y/Number Series - I defaulted this to VEND but I think this needs to be set up in the system somewhere.Can we import the EIN numbers for the vendors? I don't see a column for this data.


I finished the account schedules for the income statement, balance sheet and statement of cash flow so we can review them during our meeting tomorrow! I still need to finish up the retained earnings schedule.


I'm waiting for Jennifer to approve the final vendor import but wanted to pass along a draft first in case we needed to make changes!

Let me know if you have any questions!

Jess





Jess Hollman | Finance and Accounting Consultant
401 N. Michigan Ave. Suite 1200 | Chicago, IL 60611
Direct: 888-957-3400 ext.7571 | Email: jhollman@dlcinc.com

(LINK: http://www.dlcinc.com/)
This message is for the designated recipient only and may contain privileged, proprietary, or otherwise private information. If you have received it in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete the original. Any other use of the email by you is prohibited.

value.BodyPreview:
Hi Support,

I have been having this issue again in ESG Canada since Friday when trying to enter a ‘transaction entry’
Can you please end my session on your end? I thought it was would have automatically resolved itself over the weekend, but it did not

Body.Content:
Hi Support,

 

I have been having this issue again in ESG Canada since Friday when trying to enter a ‘transaction entry’

Can you please end my session on your end? I thought it was would have automatically resolved itself over the weekend, but it did not

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: January 30, 2018 10:33 AM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

I have ended your session.  Please attempt to log back in and advise if you run into any issues.

 

Thanks

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Tuesday, January 30, 2018 9:18 AM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

 

Is this what you mean..?

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 4:22 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

I will still need a full system screenshot of that error.  I’m sorry, we cannot troubleshoot with the current information we have.  The last screenshot did not show any open windows or any errors.

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:54 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hey Adam,

 

Im sorry but its not resolved yet. I logged out and back in again, and am getting the same message when I try to enter a transaction entry in the USA tab.

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:51 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

All should be resolved if you attempt again.

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:50 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Adam,

 

I was simply trying to enter a “transaction entry” in order to enter an invoice into our system without a PO

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:48 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

Purchase Orders are not used in the USA company.  To solve that error, one simply needs to open the POP Setup window. 

 

This should be resolved.

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:42 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Adam,

 

Because we do not use the USA tab often, I am not sure which task I was performing last on this tab. Here is a screenshot from within the USA tab and purchasing section that I use most often. I hope we can get this resolved, because I am unable to process invoices on behalf of our USA account. Thank you!

 

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 3:21 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

I reviewed your system setup and do not see any issues.  In fact, this is a system error that all users would get if it was an issue.  I see you are actively logged into the ESG company which has a ton of POs.

 

What actions were you performing immediately prior to this error?  Further, do you have a screenshot displaying your full GP window?

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:40 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Adam,

 

I removed all 4 of those.  This error message shows up when I try to input a receiving/transaction entry too

 

 

So what is next? I will close all of my windows in GP and you guys can force a session end from your end.  Will I still be able to use GP today to enter invoices into ESG etc?

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:36 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

HI Erin

 

You should click on each of those and select Remove (or Suspend if Remove is not available).  At that point, if you still see the issue, I’d ask that you close all windows and let us know.  We can then forcefully end your GP session from the server.  You’ll want to ensure all windows are closed if you do that though.

 

If you need to use GP until the end of the day in a different company, you can also start a second session by navigating to online.dynamics.gp and selecting the same icon you used to login originally.

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:31 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

 

Here is the only way I can get items in the ‘Process’ area to show up. All of the other queue and location options come up empty, so I have no options to end tasks that are still running

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:27 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>
Cc: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

Can you clarify what you mean by 3 location options?  Are you logged into GP on 3 different sessions?

 

Thanks

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:25 PM
To: Adam Macintosh <Adam.Macintosh@websan.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Adam,

 

I logged in to GP this morning and the same error message was showing from Friday. Meaning that I was logged out all weekend and the message was not cleared. I tried the Process Monitor option, and there were no items in box to be ended in my ‘normal’ queue under any 3 of my location options.

 

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com

 

 

 

From: Adam Macintosh [mailto:Adam.Macintosh@websan.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 1:21 PM
To: Erin Davis <Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com>; WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Cc: Maury Flunder <Maury.Flunder@esgsolutions.com>
Subject: RE: Issue #73775: Error message (ESG Solutions)

 

Hi Erin

 

You will get this warning if you are running a large process and it is not yet complete.  This process can be anything from a reconcile routine to a report.  Please close all windows in GP and then re-attempt to log out to see if you get the same warnings.  If you do, you likely have something in your Process Monitor.  This can be found under the Microsoft Dynamics GP menu > Process Monitor.  I suspect the top item on that queue can be ended.

 

Regards

 

Adam

 

 

From: Erin Davis [mailto:Erin.Davis@esgsolutions.com]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2018 11:47 AM
To: WebSan Support <support@websan.com>
Cc: Maury Flunder <Maury.Flunder@esgsolutions.com>
Subject: Error message

 

Hi,

 

I am trying to enter a ‘transaction entry’ in the ESG USA tab on my GP, and I am getting this error message. This message was here on Friday too, so I have already logged out and back in since then.  This message is only consistent with my computer, and not on Maurys interface. Let me know how I can fix this. Thanks.

Regards,

 

Erin Davis

Accounts Payable Administrator

 

ESG Solutions

20 Hyperion Ct., Kingston, ON, Canada, K7K 7K2

office: 613.548.8287 ext. 369, fax: 613.548.8917

erin.davis@esgsolutions.com   www.esgsolutions.com
